learning_objectives.objective: Define a certificate serial number and its basic purpose in an X.509 digital certificate.
Explain the role of the certificate serial number in distinguishing certificates within a Certificate Authority (CA)'s namespace and its contribution to the PKI trust model.
Identify the certificate serial number in a sample X.509 certificate using tools like OpenSSL.
Compare the uniqueness requirements for certificate serial numbers as specified in RFC 5280 (unique per issuer/CA) versus common misconceptions like global uniqueness.

Critique best practices for serial number generation, such as minimum 64-bit length per CA/Browser Forum guidelines, and assess risks of poor implementation (e.g., collisions leading to revocation issues).
Design a policy for generating secure certificate serial numbers, including collision avoidance strategies and compliance with RFC 5280.
